articles.headline: Montana Court to Rule on Assisted Suicide Case
articles.snippet: Montana could become the first state to declare medical aid in dying to be a right under the State Constitution.
articles.abstract: Montana could become the first state to declare medical aid in dying to be a right under the State Constitution.
articles.lead_paragraph: HELENA, Mont.  Robert Baxter was by all accounts a tough man. Even in the end, last year, as lymphocytic leukemia was killing him, Mr. Baxter, a 76-year-old retired truck driver from Billings, Mont., fought on. But by then he was struggling not for life, but for the right to die with help from his doctor.

articles.headline: Venture Firm’s ‘Green’ Funds Top $1 Billion
articles.snippet: Khosla Ventures has raised $1.1 billion in two funds that will invest in green technology and information technology start-ups.
articles.abstract: Khosla Ventures has raised $1.1 billion in two funds that will invest in green technology and information technology start-ups.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif.  Vinod Khosla, the prominent venture capitalist who has been investing hundreds of millions of his own dollars in green technology companies for the last several years, will now invest other people’s money, too.

articles.headline: Japan’s Victors Set to Abandon Market Reform
articles.snippet: Japan’s opposition party returned to power on a pledge to a shift away from deregulation and market-led growth.
articles.abstract: Japan’s opposition party returned to power on a pledge to a shift away from deregulation and market-led growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Japan’s opposition party won an overwhelming victory at the polls on Sunday pledging to increase social welfare, better protect workers and do away with American-style, pro-market reforms to lead the country out of its long slump.

articles.headline: Doubts About Scare Tactics on Drivers Who Text
articles.snippet: A small film for Welsh teenagers has been viewed millions of times. That may not mean changed behavior.
articles.abstract: A small film for Welsh teenagers has been viewed millions of times. That may not mean changed behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: American safety advocates, concerned about the dangers of texting while driving, have enjoyed a boost from an unlikely source: the chief constable of Gwent, a small county in southeast Wales.

articles.headline: Justice Department to Recharge Civil Rights Enforcement
articles.snippet: The Obama administration is adding staff and directing the division back to more traditional efforts on behalf of minorities after a shift by the Bush administration.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration is adding staff and directing the division back to more traditional efforts on behalf of minorities after a shift by the Bush administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Seven months after taking office, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. is reshaping the Justice Department’s Civil Rights Division by pushing it back into some of the most important areas of American political life, including voting rights, housing, employment, bank lending practices and redistricting after the 2010 census.

articles.headline: China Tightens Grip on Rare Minerals
articles.snippet: The government’s plan to tighten limits on the production and export of so-called rare earth elements would force more manufacturers to make their wares in China.
articles.abstract: The government’s plan to tighten limits on the production and export of so-called rare earth elements would force more manufacturers to make their wares in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  China is set to tighten its hammerlock on the market for some of the world’s most obscure but valuable minerals.

articles.headline: In a Sale, Skype Wins a Chance to Prosper
articles.snippet: The $1.9 billion deal values Skype, the Internet calling service, at $2.75 billion, higher than many analysts had expected.
articles.abstract: The $1.9 billion deal values Skype, the Internet calling service, at $2.75 billion, higher than many analysts had expected.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  With its sale to private investors, the online calling service Skype has thrown off the last of the shackles that limited its growth and potential as a unit of eBay. Now its challenge is to turn its global popularity into bigger profits.

articles.headline: Manufacturing Grows After 18 Weak Months
articles.snippet: As businesses begin to place orders to rebuild depleted inventories, factories stir to life again.
articles.abstract: As businesses begin to place orders to rebuild depleted inventories, factories stir to life again.
articles.lead_paragraph: After 18 months of layoffs, plant shutdowns and other declines, the country’s manufacturing sector grew in August, offering another piece of evidence that the economy was pulling out of recession.
